feed.title: Category: The Legend of Zelda: Link to the Past | MECHAkunEX Media Diary

entry.title: Game: The Legend of Zelda: Link to the Past (SNES, 1991) (2)
entry.content:
A few days ago... I forget when... we played again, beat the first temple and got some items in the world. My son really enjoys watching it.

Today we played up to the boss in the Tower of Hera, but were totally creamed. It is tough. I keep getting knocked off and then his health is reset.

entry.title: Game: The Legend of Zelda: Link to the Past (SNES, 1991)
entry.content:
I thought my son might like this game, given how much he enjoyed watching the beginning of Castlevania: SOTN. I also thought he might be willing to play it because the controls are simpler. I was right. He really enjoyed watching the beginning and then all of sudden he said, "Dad, how do you move? How do you attack? Can I try?" He explored the world a little and fought some enemies. He started getting frustrated because he kept dying. His problem was that he wouldn't move away from enemies when they came to attack him. He would swing his sword while the enemies were on top of him and this killed him eventually.

We got to the boss of the first temple, but I died during the stomping part.
